channel.title: Gioele La Manno on Gioele La Manno
channel.description: Recent content in Gioele La Manno on Gioele La Manno

item.title: Lada Polyakova
item.description:
Blurb

I am a PhD student in the Computational and Quantitative Biology Program (EDCB) at EPFL, working in the La Manno Lab.

item.title: The Lipidomics Architecture of the Mouse Brain
Mapping the lipid blueprint of life in 4D
Antonio Herrera appointed Group Leader
item.description:
We are proud to announce that Dr. Antonio Herrera, a postdoctoral researcher in our lab since 2021, has been awarded a prestigious Ram√≥n y Cajal fellowship!

Toni will start his own research group at the University of Granada, Spain, in the second half of 2026.

During his time in the La Manno Lab, Toni has made fundamental contributions to our research program, including developing computational methods for spatial transcriptomics analysis and contributing to multiple high-impact publications. His work on deep learning methods for imaging and spatial biology has been particularly impactful.

We are excited to see Toni establish his own independent research program and look forward to future collaborations. Congratulations Toni!

item.title: Specialized signaling centers direct cell fate and spatial organization in a limb organoid model
Unified Mass Imaging Maps the Lipidome of Vertebrate Development
Congratulations Dr. Irina Khven!
item.description:
We are delighted to announce that Irina Khven has successfully defended her PhD thesis!

Irina’s thesis, “Fine-grained mapping of neural progenitors subtypes in the embryonic brain unveils context-dependent roles of signalling on cell fate decisions,” represents a major contribution to our understanding of brain development.

During her PhD in the EDNE program (2019-2025), Irina made fundamental contributions to mapping neural progenitor diversity using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell approaches. Her work has been instrumental in establishing the lab’s spatial transcriptomics capabilities and generating some of the most comprehensive datasets on embryonic brain development.

Irina will continue her scientific career as a Postdoctoral researcher at the Institute of Molecular and Clinical Ophthalmology Basel (IOB).

Congratulations Dr. Khven, and best wishes for your future research!

item.title: Spotiflow: accurate and efficient spot detection for fluorescence microscopy with deep stereographic flow regression
Midbrain Dopaminergic Neuron Development is Regulated by Two Molecularly Distinct Subtypes of Radial Glia Cells
Congratulations Dr. Halima Hannah Schede!
item.description:
We are delighted to announce that Halima Hannah Schede has successfully defended her PhD thesis!

Halima joined as a PhD student in 2020 and completed her thesis jointly supervised with Prof. D’Angelo. Her research focused on computational approaches for spatialomics data: construction, integration, and analysis of biomolecular atlases. She developed Tomographer and made key contributions to the Lipid Brain Atlas project.

Halima has accepted a position as Lead Data Scientist at Implexis Ltd in London. Congratulations and best wishes for your future career!
